Award.AbstractNarration:
This award provides funding for US participation in the conference "The Dynamics of Algebraic Transformations" that will be held June 12-16, 2017 at the University of Rennes (France.)

The conference focuses on recent developments in Analysis, especially in the fields of several complex variables and dynamical systems. A number of distinguished mathematicians have agreed to attend and speak at this conference. This award gives early career researchers, members of underrepresented groups, researchers not funded by NSF and the like an opportunity to attend and participate in this conference. The organizing committee will strive to make this funding opportunity known to target groups through a number of different activities. More information will be made available at: http://www.lebesgue.fr/content/sem2017-dyn-alg

Institution.Name: Regents of the University of Michigan - Ann Arbor
Institution.ORG_LGL_BUS_NAME: REGENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF MICHIGAN

POR.DRECONTENT:
The international conference in mathematics with the title "Families of Algebraic Dynamical Systems" was held during June 12-16 2017, at the University of Rennes, France. It focused on recent developments on the dynamics of rational transformations. This is an area within the larger area of dynamical systems, which aims to understand, from a rigouous mathematical point of view, the long-range behavior of various phenomena that develop over time. Sometimes, the area goes under the name "chaos theory". 

The conference had three minicourses and several research talks. The lecturers of the minicourses and the senior speakers were chosen not only on the basis of their research credentials, but also for being superior expositors with a dedication to the development of younger generations of researchers and teachers in mathematics. During the conference, there was ample time set aside for informal discussons among the conference participants. Overall, the conference was of great benefit for both senior and junior participants.

While the conference was international, the local organizers did not have enough funding for participants outside Europe, and the NSF grant was instrumental in making it possible for junior US participants to come to this conference. A majority of the supported people came from underrepresented groups.  


Last Modified: 06/02/2018
Modified by: Mattias Jonsson
